Article.ArticleTitle: Photoenhanced heterogeneous reaction of O<sub>3</sub> with humic acid: Focus on O<sub>3</sub> uptake and changes in the composition and optical property.

AbstractText: Heterogeneous photochemical reaction of O<sub>3</sub> with humic acid (HA) under simulated sunlight was performed using a flow tube reactor coupled to an O<sub>3</sub> analyzer at ambient pressure. It was confirmed that light significantly enhanced the uptake of O<sub>3</sub> on HA. The initial uptake coefficient (γ<sub>i</sub>) and the steady-state uptake coefficient (γ<sub>ss</sub>) of O<sub>3</sub> under irradiation increased by 1.6 and 3.8 times compared to those in the dark, respectively. The γ<sub>i</sub> and γ<sub>ss</sub> on HA varied in the range of 0.76-2.77 × 10<sup>-5</sup> and 1.50-9.55 × 10<sup>-</sup><sup>6</sup>, respectively, which were dependent on various environmental factors including HA mass, total irradiance, initial O<sub>3</sub> concentration, O<sub>2</sub> content, temperature, relative humidity (RH) and HA solution pH. Both γ<sub>i</sub> and γ<sub>ss</sub> showed linear dependence on the total irradiance (0-2.07 × 10<sup>16</sup> photons/(cm<sup>2</sup>⋅s)) of the light source, and increased with the HA mass (0-3.2 μg/cm<sup>2</sup>), temperature (278-298 K) and HA solution pH (4.0-9.6). However, they showed negative correlations with the initial O<sub>3</sub> concentration and O<sub>2</sub> content. The γ<sub>i</sub> remained constant in the RH range of 7%-60%, while γ<sub>ss</sub> exhibited the maximum value at RH = 20%. During the ozonization of HA under irradiation, some functional groups were consumed, including CH<sub>2</sub>, CH<sub>3</sub>, aromatic CC, OH, CO, COOH and COO<sup>-</sup>. HA aged by O<sub>3</sub> exhibited a decrease in the mass absorption efficiency (MAE) and a small increase in the absorption Ångström exponent between 300 and 600 nm wavelength (AAE<sub>300,600</sub>), which was ascribed to changes in the composition of HA during the photochemical ozonization process.
